fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article about the Welsh language referred to a valley that was flooded to create a reservoir to provide water to the city of Liverpool. The damming of the river Tryweryn, which drowned the village of Capel Celyn and created Llyn Celyn, happened in 1965, not 1956 as we said (How Welsh became cool, 13 June, page 8, G2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Human society under urgent threat from loss of Earth’s natural life Carnivorous plants have a taste for salamanders, scientists find
